channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

item.title: Trump delivers his acceptance speech from White House on final night of RNC
Trump speaks at RNC in front of packed crowd with no visible social distancing
Pence said Americans won't be safe with Biden. See his response
item.description: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden tells CNN's Anderson Cooper he believes President Donald Trump and his allies are "rooting for violence" because it exploits fear for their political gain.

item.title: Jacob Blake is handcuffed to his hospital bed, family says
Hurricane Laura kills at least six and leaves widespread wind damage
Chemical fire burns at Louisiana plant as Laura moves inland and weakens
White House says it's compiling dossier on journalists
item.description: • Chinese dissident brought to US by Obama admin. praises Trump at RNC • Analysis: Trump's most irresponsible theory on Biden yet

item.title: New book details behind-the-scenes tensions between Melania and Ivanka Trump
item.description: Melania Trump's former confidant Stephanie Winston Wolkoff is dishing out a behind-the-scenes look at the allegedly contentious relationship between the first lady and first daughter Ivanka Trump.

item.title: Sea cucumbers are helping Costco clean up in China
item.description: When Costco opened its first store in mainland China last August, absolute chaos ensued.

item.title: Iowa judge voids 50,000 absentee ballot applications, prompting county to send new forms
item.description: A state judge in Iowa's second-largest county has invalidated more than 50,000 applications for absentee ballots, prompting election officials to re-send applications to thousands of voters because of problems with the original forms.

item.title: US and UK are bottom of the pile in rankings of governments' handling of coronavirus pandemic
item.description: Americans rank dead last -- by a long way -- among citizens of more than a dozen countries who were asked whether their nation is more united now than it was before the coronavirus pandemic, according to a survey released Thursday.

item.title: New cases are down, but US still averaging more than 900 Covid-19 deaths a day
President Trump and Melania mingle in crowd without masks at RNC
item.description: President Trump and first lady Melania Trump gathered near many supporters who were not wearing masks at the 2020 GOP national convention following Vice President Mike Pence's acceptance speech. CNN's Kaitlan Collins has more.

item.title: Man shot by Secret Service officer outside White House was holding a black comb and suffers from mental illness, court documents say
item.description: A Secret Service officer, who shot a Black man outside the White House earlier this month, mistook the black comb in the man's hands for a gun, according to an affidavit filed Wednesday.

item.title: UK extends travel restrictions on day it posts highest case total in two months
Peach recall expanded after 78 sickened in 12 states
item.description: A peach recall has expanded to include loose peaches and peach products after 78 people were sickened in 12 states by salmonella poisoning linked to the fruit, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said Thursday.

item.title: Chinese dissident brought to US by Obama administration praises Trump at RNC
item.description: A Chinese human rights activist brought to the United States by the Obama administration appeared at the Republican National Convention Wednesday, where he praised President Donald Trump.

item.title: Here's Donald Trump's most irresponsible theory yet about Joe Biden
item.description: President Donald Trump has spent a lot of breath -- and tweets -- attempting to cast former Vice President Joe Biden as a doddering old man who doesn't really know what's going on.

item.title: Fact checker on RNC: I don't know where to start
item.description: CNN's Daniel Dale fact checks speakers from night three of the 2020 Republican National Convention. Visit CNN's Facts First database for more fact checks.

item.title: R. Kelly attacked by fellow inmate in his jail cell, attorneys say
item.description: Attorneys for R. Kelly say he was attacked in his Illinois jail cell by a fellow inmate, and they are calling for his release.

item.title: Vaping ad tactics 'exploited' the pandemic, study says
item.description: A free roll of toilet paper with your vape? How about hand sanitizer?

item.title: Walmart joins Microsoft in pursuit of TikTok
US Coast Guard watchman shoots at shark to protect crew swimming in water
item.description: A handful of US Coast Guard members had a close encounter with a shark during a dip in the ocean earlier this week.

item.title: In this dinosaur egg, the baby wasn't what researchers expected
item.description: Before long-necked dinosaurs like Brontosaurus grew into their giant bodies, they began as baby dinosaurs with some unusual facial features that changed as they aged, according to a new study.

item.title: 2020 election could come down to this single state
item.description: CNN's John King weighs how key toss-up states might vote in the 2020 presidential election, demonstrating just how close the race could be.

item.title: TikTok Holocaust trend 'hurtful and offensive,' says Auschwitz museum
item.description: The Auschwitz Memorial has criticized a trend on TikTok in which young people portray themselves as victims of the Holocaust, saying the videos can be "hurtful and offensive."

item.title: NBA players decide to resume playoffs, reports say
Fox News host defends actions of teen charged in Kenosha shooting
item.description: Fox News host Tucker Carlson suggested it was not surprising that the teenager arrested in connection to a shooting in Kenosha, Wisconsin, allegedly took up arms and tried to "maintain order" during protests.

item.title: MLK's March on Washington speech foretold this seismic moment
item.description: Friday's March on Washington 2020, nicknamed by organizers "Get Your Knees off Our Necks," takes place on the 57th Anniversary of the March On Washington. This year's march, which is focused on ending police brutality by reimagining public safety, occurs amid a year of plague and moral and political reckoning surrounding Black citizenship and dignity.

item.title: Jeff Bezos is now worth a whopping $200 billion
item.description: Jeff Bezos was already the world's richest man. Now his net worth has skyrocketed once again, setting another new record.

item.title: Kellyanne Conway full speech: Trump helped me shatter barrier in politics
item.description: Counselor to President Trump Kellyanne Conway delivers remarks at the National Republican Convention just days after announcing that she is leaving her White House job. Watch more videos from the RNC here.

item.title: 'Bill & Ted Face the Music' isn't excellent, but it's still kind of fun
item.description: To those who might be a little fuzzy on their Bill & Ted history, fair enough dudes, it's been, like, 29 years since the last sequel. Undaunted, Keanu Reeves and Alex Winter party on in "Bill & Ted Face the Music," another adventure in nostalgia that nobody really needed and yet, if not excellent, manages to be good-hearted and reasonably fun.

item.title: Joe Biden condemns 'needless violence' after Kenosha unrest
item.description: In a new video posted to Twitter, Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden says he spoke to Jacob Blake's family after Blake was shot in Kenosha, Wisconsin.

item.title: Done with gin, Snoop Dogg turns to a different juice
item.description: When Snoop Dogg (Calvin Cordozar Broadus Jr.) exploded on the scene in the early '90s, one of the young rapper's first major hits was an ode to gin and juice, among other things. But as the rapper nears his 50th birthday, the multiplatinum artist has developed a more subdued drinking habit.

item.title: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli are expecting
item.description: Congratulations are in order for Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli.

item.title: Two teenagers left on one of the last flights out of Armenia. Now their parents are stranded
item.description: Arpy Kardashian sleeps with the phone under her pillow so she doesn't miss a call from her children. She's in Armenia, they're in Australia.

item.title: Want to order the new PlayStation 5? Good luck
item.description: If you were hoping to preorder the PlayStation 5 as soon as possible, be prepared to jump through several hoops.

item.title: Afghanistan floods kill dozens, with many still missing
item.description: Flash flooding in Afghanistan's Parwan province has killed at least 86 people and injured at least 106, according to Rahmatullah Haidari, deputy spokesman for the governor of the province said Thursday.

item.title: John Bolton on RNC from White House: It's unseemly
item.description: President Donald Trump's former national security adviser John Bolton calls portions of the 2020 Republican National Convention being held at the White House a "destruction of standards."

item.title: Artificial pancreas helps children as young as 6 with type 1 diabetes, study finds
item.description: An artificial pancreas system is safe and helped children as young as six with type 1 diabetes better control blood sugar levels, according to a new study from researchers at four pediatric diabetes centers in the United States. The study was published Wednesday in the New England Journal of Medicine.

item.title: Kevin Hart calls NBC's Usain Bolt mistake 'disrespectful'
item.description: Kevin Hart speaks out about keeping his coronavirus diagnosis a secret and NBC News mistakenly using his photo instead of US Olympic star Usain Bolt's. Melissa Knowles reports.

item.title: France's Paul Pogba tests positive for Covid-19, says coach Didier Deschamps
item.description: Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba will not take part of France's next two Nations League games against Sweden (29 Aug) and Croatia (8 Sep) after he tested positive for the Coronavirus, France's coach Didier Deschamps said in a press conference on Thursday.

item.title: Controversy over Breonna Taylor on Vanity Fair's cover
item.description: Social Media response to Breonna Taylor's portrait on the cover of the September issue of Vanity Fair magazine has been mixed. HLN's Melissa Knowles covers the story.

item.title: The US President defends his widely criticized handling of the pandemic as he acknowledges the lives lost due to Covid-19
Fact-checking the last night of the RNC
item.description: Though President Donald Trump has made appearances throughout the week, tonight he formally addresses the Republican National Convention and accepts the party's re-nomination.

item.title: Opinion: How to make the Trump-Biden debates fair
item.description: There are going to be presidential debates this fall. Speaker Nancy Pelosi makes a strong point, though, that President Donald Trump, who has lied, misled and made false claims more than 22,000 times, according to the Washington Post, has not earned the right to stand on the stage with Joe Biden because he can't tell the truth. Regardless, there will be debates.

item.title: Harris slams Trump's handling of Covid-19: 'He was scared'
item.description: • Live Updates: White House announces purchase of 150 million rapid Covid-19 tests • Opinion: Jerry Seinfeld is right about New York's future

item.title: Jacob Blake is handcuffed to his hospital bed, family says
item.description: • What we know about the officer who shot Jacob Blake • Biden: Trump is rooting for violence • Alleged Kenosha shooter's social media displays affinity for guns, Trump

item.title: US ranks last in governments' handling of pandemic
item.description: Americans rank dead last -- by a long way -- among citizens of more than a dozen countries who were asked whether their nation is more united now than it was before the coronavirus pandemic, according to a survey released Thursday.

item.title: Hurricane Laura kills at least 6 and leaves widespread wind damage
